definition: topic/problem for discussion/exam question/subject/to inscribe/to mention/CL:個|个[ge4],道[dao4]

sentences.english: Curing parents by cutting thigh is the common topic to promote filial piety in the dramas of the Ming and Qing Dynasties.

sentences.english: One chapter, investigate time spirit and reasons of theme choice.
sentences.chinese: 第一部分，考察南朝辞赋题材选择的时代精神及原因。

sentences.english: I'm interested. It's a good story, Connie.

sentences.english: The sculpture is interesting for the refined or clumsy style, and its theme is propitious, the color jubilating .

sentences.english: It was a follow-up on something I had written before.

sentences.english: This is the first time that stamps portraying Chinese zodiac animals have been issued globally.

sentences.english: Comparing it with other works of the same genre in the history, people can find its characteristics of inheritance and improvement.

sentences.english: A new television series is the latest dramatisation of the Camelot myth.

sentences.english: This realistic melodrama about urban people's emotional life became an instant hot topic among the audience.

sentences.english: This is good material for a play.
Inthe third part, the author discusses the produce of teleplays based on history.

sentences.english: I saw a good theme in a newspaper, which can be put into a drama.

sentences.english: In the army brigade drama, the "movie eighteen years" has a typical representative.

sentences.english: He wants to write about kings and wars.

sentences.english: There are many stories of transfiguration at home and abroad.

sentences.english: But they share a charming tenderness. They became the template for all culturally-relevant vampires that followed them.
